Edited August 11, 2013 by HaRdRiVe81

Nice stuff! I think I know what happened with the space station. The Tri-hexagonal struts mod put too much of the detail in the part and not enough in the textures. When used en masse, the poly count is insane and it really limits orbital work. It does look cool though. Really like your munbase work.

EDIT: you may like my stockless space program challenge.

Hi Captain, Thank you for the feedback !

Too bad with the tri-hexagonal, really liked the visual, but as you said, not usuable on big projects ! I'm at a point in Kerbal where the engine limits my creation ! And I have a good PC, I hope they will optimize it soon.

What is the Stockless Space Program Challenge ?

Well, in .22 we can expect 64 bit support (yay, that's the first step towards multi-threading!). The Stockless Space Program is over in the Challenges subforum and is exactly what the name implies. It is an ongoing thing where there are challenges every 3-4 weeks (roughly short of monthly) that you have to complete with 0 stock parts.

Nice Work! i really like the Mun base. bobcats stuff is great as a foundation, you can always count on it working perfectly.

Well, in .22 we can expect 64 bit support (yay, that's the first step towards multi-threading!).

i am sooooo looking forward to that, my ksp is crashing on a regular basis, cause the game runs out of useable memory......
Your Mun base is EXCELLENT. Likewise the space station is spectacular, I always cringe when I see a space station link because most of them I have seen are butt ugly.
Thank you all for your feedback, really appreciated. If any of you is interested, I still have the .craft files for the mun station. The space station is unfortunately broken due to 0.21.
